After the black mat’s discovery at Pilauco, several stratigraphic sections on the west wall of the excavations were sampled for different environmental and potential impact-related proxies. Grid 8AD samples were examined for seeds, magnetic spherules, and Pt concentrations (Supplementary Fig. S2). Samples from grid 10AD were examined for charcoal and pollen concentrations (Fig. 2), and grid 14AD was sampled for radiocarbon dating and Sporormiella spp. spores (Supplementary Fig. S3). All grids were examined for megafaunal remains, wood fragments, and lithic artifacts
28 . The potential presence at Pilauco of meltglass, carbon spherules, glasslike carbon, and other reported YDB proxies has yet to be investigated. Experiments are underway to investigate the presence of nanodiamonds and aciniform carbon/soot that often are associated with cosmic impact events
